content.clear_identity: Establish a consistent and authentic brand across all platforms, including a strong campaign message, logo, colors, and tone of voice.
content.core_message: Clearly communicate what the candidate stands for, focusing on their personal connection to the town and local issues.
content.consistency: Use consistent messaging and visuals across platforms to reinforce the campaign identity.

content.personal_connections: Start by reaching out to friends, family, neighbors, and local contacts. Encourage them to follow and share the candidate’s social media.
content.community_involvement: Engage with local organizations, schools, clubs, or interest groups. Attend events and mention them in posts to increase visibility.
content.email_lists: Build an email list of local supporters and use email marketing to promote the candidate’s social media.

content.facebook: Ideal for community engagement, local events, and discussions.
content.instagram: Great for visuals and behind-the-scenes stories.
content.youtube: Perfect for longer-form content such as speeches or Q&As.
content.twitter: Useful for rapid responses to local issues or news.
content.nextdoor: Highly local-focused platform to connect with specific neighborhoods.

content.posting_schedule: Post 2-4 times a week with a focus on quality.
content.engage_with_local_issues: Post content that speaks directly to local issues, events, or community concerns.
content.content_types: Videos (introductions, Q&A sessions), Infographics (showing data on issues), Personal stories, and Behind-the-scenes posts.

content.call_to_action: End each post with a call-to-action asking followers to engage by commenting, sharing, or asking questions.
content.engage_with_comments: Respond to comments and questions to foster dialogue.
content.polls_and_surveys: Use polls and surveys to generate engagement and gain insight into voter concerns.

content.community_leaders: Partner with local leaders, small business owners, or nonprofit organizers to broaden the candidate’s reach.
content.local_businesses: Feature local businesses or attend community events to increase visibility.

content.targeted_facebook_ads: Use highly targeted Facebook or Instagram ads to reach local voters based on location, interests, and demographics.
content.boost_key_posts: Boost posts that perform well organically to increase their reach.

content.visual_appeal: Create visually appealing content like infographics, short videos, or memes that are easy to share.
content.emotional_connection: Post stories that show the candidate’s connection to the community to encourage sharing.

content.join_local_groups: Be active in local Facebook groups, forums, or subreddits to engage in discussions around town issues.
content.local_hashtags: Use local or community-based hashtags to increase visibility in local conversations.
content.repost_community_content: Share local news, events, or community achievements to show engagement with the town.

content.live_streams: Host live Q&A sessions or 'Ask Me Anything' events on Facebook or YouTube to engage directly with voters.
content.virtual_town_halls: Hold virtual town halls to allow voters to ask questions and interact with the candidate.

content.newsletter_content: Send regular email newsletters to update supporters on campaign progress and include links to social media content.
content.action_oriented: Include clear calls-to-action in newsletters to encourage following on social media or attending campaign events.

content.thank_supporters: Publicly thank volunteers or donors and feature them in posts or videos to show momentum.
content.user_generated_content: Encourage followers to post about the campaign and tag the candidate’s account, then repost their content.

content.analytics: Track engagement metrics (likes, shares, comments, video views) to understand what content resonates most with the audience.
content.adjust_based_on_feedback: Be flexible and adjust the content strategy based on what drives growth and engagement.
